channel.title: Pages on Lencerf's Walk
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Lencerf's Walk

item.title: About
item.description:
Programming Languages I know a little bit about

  • C/C++/Objective-C
  • Swift
  • C#
  • Python (I mean Python 3, instead of Legacy Python)
  • Mathematica (if it can be counted as a kind of programming language)
  • Haskell

Paper I have published

  1. Localization in Quantum Walks on a Honeycomb Network.1 Phys. Rev. A 92, 052305 (2015).

Devices I am using

  • MacBook Pro (13”, Mid 2012)
  • iPhone 6s
  • Raspberry Pi 3 Model B

Software I am using personally

  • OS X El Capitan: my old MacBook Pro (13’, mid 2012) overheated when it run Sierra.
  • Alfred: the entrance to any other applications.
  • Spark: a Gmail client.
  • GeoGebra: helps me draw geometrical graphics.
  • LaTeX: for writing papers and making slides.
  • Homebrew: a package manager for macOS.
  • mpv: the best and simple media player I have ever found.
  • 1Password: manages your passwords and saves your time.
  • MacVim: I am still learning it.
  • PopClip: an iOS-styled pop-up menu.
  • Beancount: Double Entry Accounting, which makes me finacially well-organized.
  1. There was an error in the PRA copy and we have corrected it in a newer version on arXiv. [return]
